wikipedia_page.main: Captain Frederick William Holmes VC (15 September 1889 – 22 October 1969) also known as F. W. Holmes was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Frederick William Holmes || British Army  || 1914 || First World War || Le Cateau

Four other VCs were won that day at Le Cateau, including one by Lance Corporal Frederick William Holmes, who wrote of Yate:  Major Yate was a thorough gentleman and a great favourite with us all.  He had had a lot of experience in the Far East and at home, and I am sure that if he had lived he would have become a general.  He was always in front, and his constant cry was "Follow me!"
* Frederick William Holmes (1889–1969), English soldier and VC recipient
Frederick William Holmes (9 August 1886 – 9 November 1944) was a British tug of war competitor who competed in the 1920 Summer Olympics. In 1920 he won the gold medal as member of the British team.
